definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
surname Ju
to bring up/to rear/Taiwan pr. [ju2]
body/oneself/personally/to bow
old variant of 躬[gong1]
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
care-worn/distressed/tired/overworked/sick/weary
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

sentences.english: It is a charge to keep and I will give it my all.
sentences.chinese: 它是一项要履行的职责，我将为此鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来总理毕生为中国革命鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: He ended up working with the terminally and critically ill children.
sentences.chinese: 他在对那些垂死的，重病的孩子们的工作上鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: His life in the struggle for the ideals for Chu dedicated.
sentences.chinese: 他一生都在为理想奋斗，为楚国鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: He really gave his all till his heart ceased to beat.
sentences.chinese: 他真是鞠躬尽瘁，死而后已。

definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

definition: until death puts an end (idiom); one's whole life/unto one's dying day
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to offer one's life in sacrifice
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
with all of one's heart
no complaints/to have no regrets
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
